page.title: 01GAZETTEER OF GILMORTON
page.content: The area is predominantly rural with one small village,Gilmorton,population approximately 700,and 2 very small villages,Kimcote and Walton.There are only a few amenities in the villages.Gilmorton has a post office,3 pubs,a butcher's,a pottery shop,a Victorian Anglican church,a recreation ground and a cricket ground.Kimcote has a church and Walton has a post office,a pub,playing-fields,a village-hall and 2 chapels. Most people work out of the area and visit neighbouring towns for recreation and leisure activities.None of the villages is on a major bus route . The surrounding farming land is used mainly for crops,silage and grazing.
